data.title: Staten Island obituaries for Tuesday, Aug. 6, 2024
data.meta_description: In honor of those who have died, here is a compilation of obituaries posted on SILive.com.
data.text:
Staten Island â€” In honor of those who have died, here is a compilation of obituaries posted on SILive. Viewing times and guest books can be seen here.

James Arthur Anderson Sr., 81, formerly of Staten Island, passed away on June 30, 2024 in Henderson, Nevada. Born on Aug. 26, 1942, James worked for the Staten Island Rapid Transit as a signal maintainer for 35 years before retiring in 2002 to help care for his twin grandchildren. He and his wife Barbara enjoyed 58 years of marriage, celebrating their 50th anniversary in 2015. Read the full obituary on SILive

William T. Klages, 75, of Staten Island, passed away on Aug. 3, 2024. He worked for the MTA in the Brooklyn bus depot for over 34 years and previously ran an automotive repair shop. Billy enjoyed motorcycles, boating, Staten Island beaches, and NASCAR. Read the full obituary on SILive.

Mary Elizabeth Smith, 82, of Blythewood Island, Loon Lake in Chestertown, N.Y., passed away on Aug. 2, 2024. Born on Staten Island, she was the loving wife of the late Chuck Smith. Mary was known for her selflessness and artistic talent. She cherished time with family at the dream home she and Chuck built on Loon Lake. Read the full obituary on SILive.
